legal_agreement.visual.login.system.term:
Visual Login System - Terms & Conditions


The Visual Login System (“VLS”) is a reliable and secure method for assigning a driver to driving data that is collected by a particular Netradyne Driver•i device. If you elect to use VLS, then in connection with your fleet’s use of VLS and based on the images of driver faces collected by Driver•i devices, Netradyne will train a machine learning model to distinguish a subsequently collected image of a driver’s face from that of other drivers who are active in your fleet. You give us all necessary permissions to do so.


The use of VLS may be subject to certain laws and regulations. Information regarding laws and regulations that may apply to your use of VLS is provided here. It is your responsibility to provide any notices and to obtain consent from all persons whose images are captured through VLS, including those required by applicable laws. You may also access a sample consent from here. Note that the information about the applicable laws and regulations and the sample consent form should not be construed as legal advice or legally sufficient.


You agree to indemnify Netradyne for any claims arising from:


a) your failure to provide such notice or to obtain such consent; and/or

b) your (or your authorized representatives') use of VLS for purposes other than driver authentication as described herein.


BY CLICKING ON THE “AGREE” BUTTON, YOU ARE CONFIRMING THAT YOU HAVE RECEIVED PROPER CONSENTS FROM EACH INDIVIDUAL WHO MAY BE IDENTIFIED BY VLS.

Audio Recording Terms & Conditions

The purpose of the Audio Recording Service ("ARS") is to enable Driveri devices to collect audio recordings to ensure the safe driving of your users and/or to gain a better understanding of what may have occurred during a specific safety incident (the "Purpose"). Once enabled, voice recordings may be captured in association with any in-cab videos.


Prior to using the ARS, it is your responsibility to obtain positive informed consent ("Consent") from your drivers and other persons near your installed devices videos for Netradyne to provide this service.


Netradyne may use, access, and retain audio recordings of persons in and near your vehicles in order to provide the ARS to you, to enforce the terms of this Agreement, and to improve our services. You and your drivers acknowledge that Netradyne may: copy your audio recordings, modify the format in which the recordings were captured to access them in different formats, use information from your audio recordings for product improvement, and access your audio recordings to provide technical support.


If you enable the ARS, you 1) agree to use the ARS only for the Purpose described above; and 2) understand that voice recordings may be captured in association with any videos. It is your responsibility to provide positive informed consent from all persons whose voices are captured through the FRS, as required by applicable law. You agree to indemnify Netradyne for any claims arising from a) your failure to provide such notice or to obtain Consent; or b) your (or your authorized representatives') use of the ARS for a Purpose other than that described herein.

RMA Terms and Conditions

Section 1: General Conditions

  1. The follow link provides general information regarding the RMA process: -https://help.netradyne.com/hc/en-us/articles/25827503024281-Initiating-and-Processing-Return-Merchandise-Authorization-RMA-
  2. If Customer is submitting an RMA request for 20 or more devices, customer should include a description describing the failure and the bench test results and engineering assessments provided by Netradyne along with the return.
  3. Netradyne will provide Customer with a return label for each device to be returned (“Return Label”). Customer must place the return label on the appropriate device(s), and include the invoice provided by Netradyne in the return shipping box.
  4. All returned Devices must be shipped to Netradyne with proper packaging to ensure safe and secure transportation. Netradyne will not be liable for any lost or damaged returns. The Customer is responsible for insuring the shipment.
  5. Returned Devices must be shipped prepaid by Customer to the address indicated on the RMA paperwork.
  6. Netradyne will validate the defective Device once it is returned and if it is determined to be in good working order, or if it is not returned to Netradyne within 30 days of Customer receiving the Return Label, Netradyne will have the right to charge the Customer for the erroneous RMA request.
  7. Upon confirmation of a non-working device, the Netradyne business operation team will initiate shipment of a replacement (or the repaired) device to Customer along with an explanation as to the failure. The replacement device will be sent with proper packaging to ensure safe and secure transportation, with standard shipment pre-paid by Netradyne. Expedited return shipping can be arranged at Customer’s request and expense.
  8. Netradyne will deactivate services for the defective Device within 30 days of shipping the replacement Device.
  9. Netradyne’s warranty covers parts and workmanship defects only and does not cover any damage due to installation, environmental or natural causes. Incidental or consequential damages are not covered by Netradyne’s warranty.

Section 2: Customer’s Obligations.

  1. Customer must complete the RMA form and upload the completed form through the Netradyne RMA Portal.
  2. The RMA Device should be wrapped in bubble sheet or packed properly to avoid any damage.
  3. The RMA Device should include all necessary part.
  4. Shipping Serial ID, Unit Price and Device ID, as shared by Netradyne, should be pasted on each device.
  5. Customer shall include the following with the RMA Device shipment:

         a. The Return label on the device

         b. All accessories depending on the Device model.

Section 3: Return for Repairs

In addition to the aforementioned terms, Devices being returned for repair are subject to the following terms and conditions:

  1. The faulty Devices will be replaced by Netradyne as per the warranty clause agreed between the parties.
  2. Warranty is void where the Device has been damaged, tampered with, or utilized in a manner that is inconsistent with its intended use.
  3. For non-warranted devices, repair fees are communicated upon issuance of an RMA. By submitting the product described in the issued RMA for repair, the Customer acknowledges and agrees that it will pay the amount charged by Netradyne, and outlined on the RMA, for the repair. Should there be any additional charges, Netradyne will contact the Customer for additional approval. If Customer wishes to cancel the repair order, Customer acknowledges that Customer will be liable to Netradyne for the original amount quoted in issued RMA, plus materials and labor for work already performed as authorized by Customer.

Visual Login System Terms & Conditions

The Visual Login System (VLS) recognizes drivers by scanning the face of the person driving the vehicle, and verifies this information against a database of other drivers within the fleet to identify the driver. If you elect to use the VLS, Netradyne may use, access, and retain videos of persons in your vehicles in order to provide the VLS to you, to enforce the terms of this Agreement, and to improve our services. You give us all necessary permissions to do so. These permissions include, for example, the right to copy your videos, the right to modify your videos to access them in different formats, the right to use information from your videos for database comparisons and driver identification, and the right to access your videos to provide technical support.

If you enable the VLS, you 1) agree to use the VLS only for the purpose described above; and 2) understand that image recognition analysis will be performed on in-cab videos. It is your responsibility to provide any notices and to obtain consents from all persons whose images are captured through the VLS, including those required by applicable law. You agree to indemnify Netradyne for any claims arising from a) your failure to provide such notice or to obtain such consent; or b) your (or your authorized representative"s) use of the VLS for purposes other than driver identification as described herein.

To discuss next steps regarding this device, we recommend that you reach out to your respective Customer Success Manager. They can assist you with further actions and provide guidance on how to proceed.

If you have any further questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to contact us.

ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.addedto: Added to Managed Coaching Session: Returns "Yes" or "No". "Yes" means the alert has been added to a managed coaching session and "No" means it has not.
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.alertde: Alert Description: The description of the alert
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.alertid: Alert ID :Unique identification number assigned to each alert
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.alertre: Alert Rejected By: Full name of the user who rejected the alert. NA if the alert has not been rejected.
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.alertse: Alert Severity: The severity of the alert determined as either moderate, severe or neutral
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.alertty: Alert Type: The type of alert that was triggered by driver behavior
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.alertvi: Alert Video Status: The status of the alert video
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.devicei: Device ID: The ID assigned to the device that generated the alert.
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.driveri: Driver ID: The unique ID assigned to a driver
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.drivern: Driver Name: The first and last name of the driver
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.driving: Driving Conditions: Shows the driving conditions for the alert as shown in the IDMS page.
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.duratio: Duration(sec): The duration of the alert
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.group: Group: The group the driver is associated with
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.latitud: Latitude: The latitude for the location of the alert
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.longitu: Longitude: The latitude for the location of the alert
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.managed: Managed Coaching Session Closed By : Full name of the user that closed the coaching session. NA if the coaching session is pending or has not been opened. This can be repeated since each coaching session can have multiple alerts and comments.

Managed Coaching Session Comments: Comments from the managed coaching session that has been closed. NA if the alert has not been added to a coaching session or if the coaching session pending. This can be repeated since each coaching session can have multiple alerts and comments.
Managed Coaching Session Complete Date: The date managed coaching was completed.

Managed Coaching Session ID: ID for coaching session that links back to the IDMS coaching sessions. NA if the alert has not been added to a coaching session. This can be repeated since each coaching session can have multiple alerts and comments.

Managed Coaching Session Opened Date: The date the managed coaching session was opened. NA if the alert has not been added to a coaching session. This can be repeated since each coaching session can have multiple alerts and comments.

Managed Coaching Session Status: Should return pending, completed or NA in cases where the alert has not been added to a coaching session. This can be repeated since each coaching session can have multiple alerts and comments.
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.rejecte: Rejected Alert: Returns “Yes” or “No”. “Yes” means the alert has been rejected. “No” means the alert has not been rejected.
Rejected Alert Comments: Comments made on rejected alerts. NA if the alert is not rejected or if the alert is rejected and no comments are populated.
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.timesta: Timestamp: Alert timestamp in local time zone
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.vehicle: Vehicle Number: The unique identification number assigned to a vehicle by the fleet
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.videose: Video Sent to Driver App for Review: Returns "Yes" or "No". "Yes" means the video was sent to the Driver App for Review. "No" means the videos was not sent to the driver app for review.
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.vin: VIN: The unique vehicle identification number
ndreportscolumndetails.allalerts.virtual: Virtual Coaching Completed: Returns "Yes" or "No". "Yes" means virtual coaching was completed. "No" virtual coaching has not been completed for the alert.
Virtual Coaching Complete Date: The date the virtual coaching session was completed
